result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Allen Nessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $1,800.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but only eligible after serving at least one year of Initial Confinement time in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescriptions.  No contact with drug community.
AODA assessment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition inerlock device for three years to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Allen Nessler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to BLACK RIVER CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATT. AMENDED JOC W6898 E STAFFON RD. BLACK RIVER FALLS WI 54615

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP.
  
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by a DOC records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 26, Judge POCAN. ew
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Post-Judgment Motion for IID Exemptions, filed and signed by the Court.  Copy forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but only eligible after serving at least 1 year of initial confinement time in this case.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Court orders AODA assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.
- Defendant to cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescriptions.
- No contact with drug community.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Court ordered defendants driving privileges revoked for a period of 3 years.
- Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 3 years to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated. 
- Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1,800.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting and Acknowledgement;
Driver Assessment and Driver Safely Plan.

Defendant Scott Allen Nessler in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Defendant Scott Allen Nessler in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant waived constitutional rights and pled guilty. Guilty Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Defendant advised of the following restrictions: No Firearms/ Voting. Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defense request IID exemption be lifted from certain vehicles of defendant. Court will not take any action at this time on IID exemptions.
Letter with proposed order received and filed. tk
Letters filed on behalf of the defenant from defense counsel received and filed. tk
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Scott Allen Nessler in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  James C. Griffin appeared for Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court, Defendant Scott Allen Nessler not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing. Parties are awaiting blood results. Defendant will not be produced for the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court, defendant Scott Allen Nessler not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Scott Allen Nessler in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Defendant Scott Allen Nessler in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
